headline: Did Wabtec’s New MTA Hybrid Locomotive Deal Just Recast Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies' (WAB) Investment Narrative?
summary: In early January 2026, Wabtec Corporation announced a follow-on US$386 million order from New York’s MTA for hybrid battery-diesel R255 work locomotives, including spare parts, with production in Erie, Pennsylvania and deliveries starting in 2027 to support cleaner, more efficient transit maintenance. This contract underlines Wabtec’s positioning in lower-emission rail solutions and digitally enabled maintenance, potentially reinforcing its role in global rail modernization projects. Against...

This contract underlines Wabtec’s positioning in lower-emission rail solutions and digitally enabled maintenance, potentially reinforcing its role in global rail modernization projects. Against...

headline: Is It Too Late To Reassess Wabtec (WAB) After Its Strong Multi‑Year Share Price Run?
summary: If you are wondering whether Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies is still fairly priced after its strong run, this article will walk you through what the current share price could mean for value focused investors. The stock last closed at US$229.60, with returns of 2.3% over the past 7 days, 8.3% over 30 days, 6.2% year to date, 14.4% over 1 year, 129.2% over 3 years and 193.6% over 5 years. These results may have shifted how the market is thinking about its risk and return trade off. Recent...
